Cédric Beust ♔ wrote:
> On 5/11/06, J. B. Rainsberger <jbrains@...> wrote:
>  >
>  >
>  > I don't mean to be rude, so please interpret what I'm about to say in
>  > the nicest possible way. I don't understand why /any/ project would ask
>  > non-coders (or people who can code, but are not allowed to code on the
>  > project, like testers) to test any code with JUnit.
> 
> Maybe I misunderstood, but I don't think that's what Anna said:   she just
> said she wasn't in a position to change the code of the application, but
> she's obviously coding the tests.
> 
> Which is a fairly common situation...

OK. I thought it was the case that Anna needs to "request a code 
change", implying that other people write the code and she only tests. 
That is certainly different from needing to "request permission to 
change the code".

Anna, can you clarify this for us?
